newsitem.title: INDIA: India NALCO 96/97 aluminium output rises.
newsitem.headline: India NALCO 96/97 aluminium output rises.

text.p: India's state-run National Aluminium Company (NALCO) said on Tuesday it produced 203,650 tonnes of aluminium in 1996/97 (April-March) compared with 192,288 tonnes in 1995/96.
NALCO said in a statement it exported 60,357 tonnes of aluminium in 1996/97 compared with 49,128 tonnes in 1995/96.
The statement said NALCO sold 145,520 tonnes of aluminium in the domestic market in 1996/97 against 143,092 in the previous year.
It said NALCO produced 840,000 tonnes of alumina in 1996/97 compared with 807,000 tonnes in 1995/96.
The company exported 465,000 tonnes of alumina in 1996/97 compared with the previous best of 448,000 tonnes in 1989/90. The statement did not give the export figures for 1995/96.
It said NALCO's aluminium stocks stood at their lowest level ever at 700 tonnes on March 31 -- less than two days' production.
The statement said NALCO'S 720-megawatt captive power plant at Anugul in Orissa has achieved a record power generation of 4,187 million units in 1996/97 compared with 4,147 million units in 1995/96.
